channel.title: Comments on: Difference between Date, Time and DateTime
channel.description: Red Panthers - Experts in Ruby on Rails, System Design and Vue.js

item.title: By: Harikrishnan N
item.dc:creator: Harikrishnan N
item.description: The issue is only in older versions of ruby (1.9.2). Thank you for notifying. I will update the blog.
item.content:encoded: The issue is only in older versions of ruby (1.9.2). Thank you for notifying. I will update the blog.

item.title: By: Sathors
item.dc:creator: Sathors
item.description: You say that Time only stores a time of a day, whereas DateTime stores a date and a time. I don't really understand what you meant by that, because Time and DateTime have the same attributes (year, month, day, hour, min, sec).
item.content:encoded: You say that Time only stores a time of a day, whereas DateTime stores a date and a time. I don’t really understand what you meant by that, because Time and DateTime have the same attributes (year, month, day, hour, min, sec).

item.title: By: Alex Patrashko
item.dc:creator: Alex Patrashko
item.description: Time.new(8700, 10, 21, 13, 39, 56) is a valid expression. Hence the question, what did you mean by "Time can only represent dates between 1970 and 2038" ?
item.content:encoded: Time.new(8700, 10, 21, 13, 39, 56) is a valid expression. Hence the question, what did you mean by “Time can only represent dates between 1970 and 2038” ?
